name: Murmuration (braceysmith)
description:
Should you stay with the flock?

You’re safer together than you are alone, but the flock won’t always go where you need. And will sometimes go where you shouldn’t.

Do your own thing and you’ll have more control, but can get as far on your own?

You are a Starling looking for food over the floating islands of Seventy-Two Tiles.

The goal:

stay alive for as many seasons as you can.

As you fly over tiles, you reveal one of 3 island types:

  • A neutral island
  • A food island
  • An island of death

As you fly, you lose health.

If all the food is found, you live to fly another season.

Each season of the floating islands of Seventy-Two Tiles has a Food island that must be discovered.

Conversely, the amount of Death Spaces increases with each season and should be avoided at all costs.

To increase your chances of staying alive, birds of a feather, murmurate together.

If there is more than one Starling in the game, and every Starling is on the same island, all adjacent surrounding islands get revealed.

How to Murmurate:

If you’re too far, get closer

If you’re too closer, get farther

If you’re just right, do what everyone else is doing.
